section.title: Description
section.b: Sets (or removes) the attribute value of a selected input field. An example usage would be to enable a disabled input field (perhaps to mimic some unsupported javascript).

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description of this test step.

attribute.name: tagName
attribute.description: The name of the tag of interest, e.g. "input" or "select".

attribute.name: attributeName
attribute.description: The name of the attribute of interest, e.g. "disabled" or "checked".

attribute.name: attributeValue
attribute.description: The value to set for the attribute of interest; causes the attribute to be removed if set to the empty string (i.e. "").

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The value to use when setting the field of interest.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the input field of interest. One of forLabel, htmlId, name, or xpath is required.

attribute.name: forLabel
attribute.description: The text of the label field associated with the input field of interest. One of forLabel, htmlId, name, or xpath is required.

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: The xpath of the input field of interest. One of forLabel, htmlId, name, or xpath is required.

attribute.name: formName
attribute.description: The name of the form containing the field of interest. Ignored if htmlId is used.
attribute.required: no, default is the last form selected using 'selectForm', otherwise searches all forms

attribute.name: htmlId
attribute.description: The id of the input field of interest. One of forLabel, htmlId, name, or xpath is required.

attribute.name: fieldIndex
attribute.description: The index of the field of interest (starting at 0) if more than one field matches criteria. Ignored if htmlId or xpath is used.
attribute.required: no, default is the first field found that matches criteria

attribute.name: save
attribute.description: A shorthand: save='prefixName' is the same as savePrefix='prefixName' saveResponse='true'.

attribute.name: savePrefix
attribute.description: A name prefix can be specified for making a permanent copy of received responses. A unique number and the file extension (depending on the MIME-Type) will be appended. The resultpath attribute of the <config> element is used for determining the location of the saved result.
attribute.required: no, default is the 'savePrefix' parameter as specified in <config>.

attribute.name: saveResponse
attribute.description: Whether to make a permanent copy of received responses. Overrides the default value set in the <config> element.

section.title: Inline Text

attribute.name: text
attribute.description: An alternative to the attribute value for e.g. large TextAreas.
